body.p: BOWLER Ben Thornse had a birthday anniversary Thursday. Friends helped him celebrate the occasion at his home. A baby girl, Sharon Lynn, w«a born at the home of Mr, and Mrs, Harold Maines Monday, March «. Mrs. Wm. Kisnube entertained the Sbeephead Club Thursday. Prizes were won by Mrs. Herrn. Grueinvaidt, Mrs. Evan Goddaks and Mrs. Frank Kolpack. A lunch was served by the hostess. Mrs. H. Curley and Mrs. Vic. Kropf entertained the St. Paul's Ladies’ Aid Wednesday. Mrs. Ida Binder at Ciintonville is visiting at the F. A. Buettner home. Hazel Sengstock is a guest at the Van Eggert home at Ciintonville. Relatives helped Mrs. Oliver Buettner celebrate her birthday anniversary March 4. The American Lesion Post is giving a card party at the Bowler hail March 19. Game starts at 2 p. m. Sehafskopf and Mncar Admission 25 cents. The public is invited. Grandpa Reinert celebrated his 76th birthday anniversary Friday. Mr. and Mrs. Herman Grueinvaidt visited at underhiil Sunday. Mrs. Hattie Schiefeibein has moved in the upstairs rooms in the Fuhrwan building. Mr. and Mrs. Wm. C. Seeping of Gresham spent Sunday at the Emil Treptow home. Mr. and Mrs. C. O. Felts of Tiiieda visited at the F. H. Kolpack home Sunday evening. William Wiseman and his mother spent Sunday at Wausau at the Er- nest Brunner home. Robert Kleman is on the sick list. The following ladies attended the galloping tea party at Mrs. R. D. Hening’s home Monday afternoon. Captain, Mrs. Fred Weidner, Mrs. Ida Btndei, of Ciintonville, Mrs. George Weidner. Mrs. F. A. Buettner. Mrs, P Heikie, Mrs. Otto Woifgram. Mrs. H. Carlry, Mrs. M. MacKay, Mrs. G. Matt, Mrs C. Nygren and Mrs. Frank Kolpack were present. The afternoon was spent by playing 500 and checkers. A coin was donated by each guest to the hostess who in turn gives these coins to the St. Paul’s Ladies’ Aid. The hostess served a lunch and then she is now the new captain who will select a group to "gallop" to another home.
